definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: If such be Nature's holy plan.
sentences.chinese: 设若这就是大自然的神圣的旨意。

sentences.english: My secret communion with God is the place where I learn the great lessons concerning God's will.
sentences.chinese: 在与神相交的隐密处，我学到有关神旨意的伟大功课。

sentences.english: Will you serve God's purpose in your generation?
sentences.chinese: 你愿意在你的世代服事神的旨意吗？

sentences.english: For whoever does the will of myFather in heaven is my brother and sister and mother.
sentences.chinese: 凡遵行我天父旨意的人，就是我的弟兄姐妹和母亲了。

sentences.english: Without my blessing, not a leaf will fall.
sentences.chinese: 没有叶子会违背我的旨意飘落。

sentences.english: Submission to the divine will is the softest pillow on which to recline.
sentences.chinese: 服从神的旨意是最柔软的靠头枕。

sentences.english: I' Jesus honored God by fulfilling his purpose on earth. We honor God the same way.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣以成就神的旨意来归荣耀给神，我们也应当如此。

sentences.english: He who does God's will and renounces his own is truly very learned.
sentences.chinese: 真正博学的人尊行上帝的旨意，丢弃自己的意思。

sentences.english: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God.
sentences.chinese: 因为神的旨意，我并没有一样避讳不传给你们的。

sentences.english: The Holy Spirit equips us to obey the Lord in whatever He calls us to do.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何得主的召唤，圣灵令我们遵从他的旨意行事。

sentences.english: The Bible says, "Don't act thoughtlessly, but understand what the Lord wants you to do.
sentences.chinese: 圣经上说，“不要做糊涂人，要明白主的旨意如何。”

sentences.english: For [it is] better, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.
sentences.chinese: 神的旨意若叫你们因行善受苦，总强如因行恶受苦。

sentences.english: Paul, apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God and Timothy our brother.
sentences.chinese: 因天主的旨意作基督耶稣宗徒的保禄与弟茂德弟兄。

sentences.english: Paul , an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God , and Timotheus our brother , bbe.
sentences.chinese: 奉神旨意，作基督耶稣使徒的保罗，和兄弟提摩太。

sentences.english: Just trust, and trust, and trust, until His will you know.
sentences.chinese: 只有信主，深信祂，直到你明白祂的旨意和嘱咐。

sentences.english: Go down, Bill Dalton, it must be God's will.
sentences.chinese: 倒下吧，比尔道顿，那必然是上帝的旨意。

definition: imperial edict/see also 上諭|上谕[shang4 yu4]
to issue a directive/to instruct (that sth be done)
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
